title: Learning Journey AI
description: AI-powered learning platform that provides job-relevant project-based education modules. Also offers hands-on AI literacy workshops and professional training for individuals and organizations.

title: Congress.gov MCP Server
description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server providing comprehensive access to the official Congress.gov API (v3). Features 74 tools covering bills, members, committees, hearings, nominations, treaties, and more. Built with FastMCP.

title: Fool 'Em Once
description: Research study on AI text detection vulnerabilities. Found that 89% of AI-generated essays evaded detection after humanization, with detection rates dropping from 97.4% to 10.5%. Powered by Claude Code.

title: Booklingly
description: AI-powered language learning tool that generates customizable illustrated scenes with labeled objects in 21 languages, complete with IPA pronunciation guides.

title: Witness Witness
description: Interactive tool for exploring Congressional hearing witness records. Built for the 2025 Congressional Hackathon with Nick Ashworth and OpenAI Codex.

title: BASIS
description: Autonomous research assistant for end-to-end DFT calculations in materials science. I developed the literature search and reading agent that mines scientific papers to inform simulation planning. Multi-agent system built with team.

title: AI Reading List for Policy People
description: Curated collection of AI resources for policymakers and government professionals working at the intersection of artificial intelligence and public policy.

title: Speak Up
description: AI-powered oral exam platform that dynamically generates questions from teacher rubrics, tracks student progress with real-time struggle detection, and supports multilingual exams with text-to-speech. Prototyped at the Cursor Hackathon on January 30, 2026.

title: Proposal Utility Suite
description: Analyze proposal concept outlines with AI models to compare submissions against rubrics, generate synthetic data, and tag proposals automatically. Work in progress! :)

title: Science RFIs
description: Interactive resource tracking three federal Requests for Information on scientific funding and AI workforce development â€” NSF Tech Labs, OSTP Scientific Enterprise, and DOE Genesis Mission. Built for the Industrial Policy Salon, with a companion NotebookLM for deeper research.
